name: Planning & Decomposition
primaryQuestion: What are we building, in what order?
rationale: This family answers what we are building and in what order. It provides a clear breakdown of the work, defines the sequence of implementation, and explicitly lists any dependencies that could block progress. This ensures a predictable development flow and helps in resource allocation.
notes: Essential for Plans (roadmap of children); Optional for Tasks (dependencies only)

sections.name: Roadmap (In-Focus Items)
sections.description: A table of direct child Plans/Tasks that are currently planned for implementation in the active cycle.
sections.notes: Plan: Lists the immediate child Plans/Tasks being actively worked on.

sections.name: Backlog / Icebox
sections.description: A list of direct child Plans/Tasks that have been considered but are not scheduled for the current implementation cycle. This is crucial for capturing scope decisions.
sections.notes: Plan: Lists considered but de-scoped or deferred child Plans/Tasks.

items: **Reporting Plan**: Deferred to Q4 due to dependency on new analytics service.
**Real-time Collaboration Features**: Moved to Icebox as it is outside the scope of the current MVP.

sections.name: Dependencies
sections.description: An explicit list of internal or external dependencies that must be resolved before this Plan/Task can be completed.
sections.notes: Plan: External dependencies affecting this scope. Task: Other Tasks/Plans this implementation depends on.

sections.name: Decomposition Graph
sections.description: A Mermaid diagram that visually represents the dependencies and sequencing of the child Plans/Tasks listed in the `3.1 Roadmap`. This graph shows the relationship between child Plans and Tasks, clarifying the critical path and helping developers understand the required order of implementation.

content.content:
subgraph Plan: User Authentication
        P1["Plan: Backend Auth"]
        T1["Task: Create UI form"]
        T2["Task: Implement validation"]
        T3["Task: Add API endpoint"]
        T4["Task: Write integration tests"]
    end
    P1 --> T1
    T1 --> T2
    T2 --> T3
    T3 --> T4
